channel.title: Comments on: Oops, I’ve been Ed-Dotted

item.title: By: Bruce Elgort
item.dc:creator: Bruce Elgort
item.description: <p>I would be happy to host your blog on my server along with CouchDb, NotesNerd and BruceElgort.com</p><p>Just say the word.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I would be happy to host your blog on my server along with CouchDb, NotesNerd and BruceElgort.com

Just say the word.

item.title: By: Fiona White
item.dc:creator: Fiona White
item.description: <p>Hi, on a completely unrelated subject, have you come across the One Day in History blog site which encourages as many people as possible to write a blog of their day today to create a history resource for the future. I thought as you already write one it might be something which came easily!<br/><br/><br/><br/>Check it out. <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.historymatters.org.uk/output/page96.asp"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.historymatters.org.uk/output/page96.asp"</a> rel="nofollow"><a href="http://www.historymatters.org.uk/output/page96.asp" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.historymatters.org.uk/output/page96.asp</a></a><br/><br/><br/><br/>Fiona</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi, on a completely unrelated subject, have you come across the One Day in History blog site which encourages as many people as possible to write a blog of their day today to create a history resource for the future. I thought as you already write one it might be something which came easily!

Check it out. http://www.historymatters.org.uk/output/page96.asp“ rel=”nofollow”>http://www.historymatters.org.uk/output/page96.asp

Fiona

item.title: By: Laurette Rynne
item.dc:creator: Laurette Rynne
item.description: <p>We are using CoreFusion for hosting dominoblogs.com. They are based out of Canada, and are great - also very supportive of community initiatives, and reasonably priced as well.</p>
item.content:encoded: We are using CoreFusion for hosting dominoblogs.com. They are based out of Canada, and are great – also very supportive of community initiatives, and reasonably priced as well.

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p>Ah yes, the Ed Effect!</p><p>Well, I've always recommended Domino Developer Network, and they've certainly been very supportive of the Lotus blogging community generally -- could be worth a shot? Otherwise, there are Prominic, Connectria, and no doubt a few more...</p>
item.content:encoded:
Ah yes, the Ed Effect!

Well, I’ve always recommended Domino Developer Network, and they’ve certainly been very supportive of the Lotus blogging community generally — could be worth a shot? Otherwise, there are Prominic, Connectria, and no doubt a few more…
